Keywords: Reporter , Scientist , Spider-Man Family
Real Name: Peter Parker
Special Powers
ROLE TAG: Secret Identity
SPIDER-MAN NO MORE!: At the beginning of the game, you may generate a [SVC] #s006 Garbage Can in your starting area.
JONAH HATES ME EVEN MORE THAN I THOUGHT: When Spider-Man starts the game, an opponent generates a J. Jonah Jameson bystander anywhere on the map.
FOUR HOODLUMS AT ONCE!: When Spider-Man makes a close attack, he instead targets all adjacent opposing characters.
MOVEMENT: Elevated, Hindering
Trade Spider-Man Want Spider-Man

mc268
What a dial. Made me reassess the Spideys I had in my collection. He�s so incredibly good for 60 points, with the hypersonic, full suite of damage powers, amazing stats and crazy damage potential. Not to mention an Amazing sculpt, thematic dial, and the ability to deny points, and extend his life by using the trash can to turn him into Peter. The JJJ bystander is annoying, but not much of a threat to deal with. He�s now tied with the Easrth X rare and the PS4 SR as my favourite Spidey. Plus he�s only 60 points so he fits better on some builds, I was disappointed in the common from this set, but I think they put 100 points of dial and powers into this monster.

EDIT; Looks like this is just missing here on the realms. Card says he has improved movement: elevated, hindering. Was wondering why he couldn't do everything a spider can... I think the first reason he's so cheap is because of this whole not-use-the-secret-identity bit, and the other is his complete lack of improved movement. Speed pops up to an 11 with flight, and he doesn't hate the toughness.
September 21, 2020
Hatake Olee
This question was sent to hcrulesteam: "If 054 Spider-Man is replaced by 016 Peter Parker using the Garbage Can effect, can that Peter Parker later be replaced with a secret identity Spider-Man when he would be KO'd?" Their response: "No. As stated, a character can only leave and re-enter the Sideline for the specific effect it was included on your Sideline for. Since Peter Parker was included on your Sideline for the Garbage Can's effect, he would only be able re-enter the Sideline if it had an effect that allowed it (which it does not)."
September 19, 2020
ClixCommand3r
No. If Peter Parker comes in by the garbage can he cannot return to the sideline by using Secret Identity. WK could rule differently, but that is how the rules read.

September 8, 2020
ClixCommand3r
Just started thinking a little more about this guy. Maybe this was obvious to everybody else, but his attack SP works with all close attacks. So give him bloodaxe and he can exploit weakness on all adjacent characters. Give him octopus arms and he can flurry on all adjacent characters. Give him the power gem and he could close combat expert all adjacent characters. Mind gem and he could Mind control or incapacitate all adjacent characters. None of those works with HSS, and CCE won't work with charge, but it isn't hard to TK him where you need him to be. EDIT: Forgot to add Waldo Arms. They are what made me think of this. You perplex up this guy's damage then send him off to punch 4 guys at once. Then he can probably either incapacitate them all or attack them all again. Or he could punch one set, take his second move and then use his waldo arms effect on all adjacent opposing characters. Not bad!

MechaG11
Okay, okay, okay though! Is no one else freaking out about the fact that these MADMEN at Wizkids just made a Heroclix figure that has a built-in character arc throughout your clix match?! He starts as Spider-Man, is defeated (KO's garbage can), quits and becomes Peter Parker for a time after he throws away the costume, and then dawns the costume to fight again as Spider-Man (through Peter's secret identity trait)! Talk about a tribute huh? This has got to be a new height for miniatures games.
